results.title: Headliner: NoviNews
results.brief_description: Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society.

constellations_primary.name: Fake news: too little too late
constellations_primary.description: Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society, something that is fast becoming one of the biggest concerns of our age.

results.description:
Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society. Players take the role of a ‘headliner’, which is like a chief editor at a news outlet. The player must decide what stories and angles to publish, and their choices have wide-reaching effects in the game world. Reject stories about creating national healthcare services? People get sick in the street. Approve stories on the benefits of synthetic recreational drugs? Addiction runs rampant.

These stories aren’t presented as obviously ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ choices: the game lets the player’s own ethics and morals guide their decisions – which can create a peaceful society or burn it to the ground.
description_for_label:
Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society. Players take the role of a ‘headliner’, which is like a chief editor at a news outlet. The player must decide what stories and angles to publish, and their choices have wide-reaching effects in the game world. Reject stories about creating national healthcare services? People get sick in the street. Approve stories on the benefits of synthetic recreational drugs? Addiction runs rampant.

These stories aren’t presented as obviously ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ choices: the game lets the player’s own ethics and morals guide their decisions – which can create a peaceful society or burn it to the ground.

results.title: Headline hunters
results.creator_credit: Ansus Films, Frank Godwin and Jonathan Ingrams
results.brief_description: In an English midlands town, the owner of a newspaper (The Clarion) has a heart attack. His rival, (The Bugle) uses nasty tactics to close the Clarion, but through the wiles of the Clarion owner’s children, this misfires badly, and ends happily. Cast includes Leonard Brockwell, Susan Payne, Stephen Garlick, Jeffrey Chandler, Bill Owen.

results.title: Headin' for Broadway
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Joseph Brooks
results.brief_description: The lives of four young ambitious would-be Broadway performers is portrayed through the eyes of a documentary filmmaker. Fast Eddie (Rex Smith), Carrie Richards (Terri Treas), Valerie Walker (Vivian Reed) and Ralph Morelli (Paul Caratotes) although coming from very different backgrounds, all share the same aspirations and passion to make it on Broadway. In similar tradition to “Fame” this film is predominantly a music and dance scenario typical of the late 1970s and early 1980s, and features music and lyrics by awarding-winning composer Joseph Brooks.

results.title: Headfirst
results.brief_description: Filmed in Melbourne, this docudrama consists of individual stories, poetry and performance by a cast of people who all share a similar disability of Acquired Brian Damage. In a population of 5.5 million, it is estimated that there will be 10,000 head injuries per year - 70% caused by road accidents, 40% between 17 and 25 years old, and two-thirds men and boys. Acquired Brain Damage can cause memory loss, fragmentation of thoughts, confusion and loss of co-ordination, but worse still, it can lead to difficulty in holding a job, alienation, loneliness, family and marital break-ups and suicide. Emphasis is put on rehabilitation and the self-help group called Headway where support and guidance is offered for those who are finding it difficult to fit back into “normal” society. This is a confronting story which questions social values and attitudes but contains an amazing depth of character and performance by the cast upon whose experiences this film is based. The film ends with a very important message: “Head injury requires immediate action - Prevention, Rehabilitation, Support, Community Education”. Includes study notes. Cast includes Diane Redman-Heath (Anne), Dianne Cousland (Rosie) and Maurice Keating (Bernie). Poetry by Stanley Newbury and Maurice Keating. This has been a collaboration of the following student scriptwriters/directors: Fran Bosch, Sam Briggs, Joanne Hampton, Grant Hobson, Vicki Holmes, Miriam Krohn, Peter Lawrence, Roland Linssen, Ugo Mantelli, Mathew McRae, Debbi Rose and Vicki Toll.

results.title: head_phone_film_poems
results.brief_description:
head_phone_film_poems is a collection of thirteen films that creatively remix material from online archives including the Australian Security Intelligence Organisation (ASIO) film material in the National Archives of Australia, crime scene photographs from the Justice and Police Museum Sydney, and Gibson’s own social-media-stored collection of strange late-night phenomena filmed in his neighbourhood over the past decade. Drawing on these caches of ‘readymade’ footage, the head_phone_film_poems are shaped by three guiding principles: they must be produced entirely on the iPhone, they must feature some visualised language and they must suggest an enormous amount more than they show.

[Sourced from ACMI website event page https://www.acmi.net.au/whats-on/ross-gibson-head_phone_film_poems/ 9/6/2021]

Drawing on these caches of ‘readymade’ footage, the head_phone_film_poems are shaped by three guiding principles: they must be produced entirely on the iPhone, they must feature some visualised language and they must suggest an enormous amount more than they show.

results.title: Head start: meeting the computer challenge
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Kathleen Shannon and Diane Beaudry
results.brief_description: Intended for women in the paid work force and young girls about to choose a career, this half-hour film, part drama, part documentary, urges viewers to acquire the skills for careers involving new technologies. In the documentary segments, women who hold senior positions in the field of microtechnology describe changing occupational patterns, and stress the need for training and job-mobility programs. In the dramatic portions, an office worker and her teenaged daughter discover how the technological revolution will affect their careers and decide how to attain their goal of financial independence.

results.title: Head over heels
results.creator_credit: Universal Studios, Robert Simonds and Mark Waters
results.brief_description: Australian supermodel Sarah O’Hare makes her acting debut as one of four models to share a plush Manhatten apartment with our protagonist, Amanda (Monica Potter). Single Amanda is cursed with dating the wrong men and when she spots handsome Jim Winston (Freddie Prinze Jr,) out her window - a man she met under curious circumstances in the lobby - she becomes instantly attracted and decidedly cautious. Under the guidance of her new flatmates, Amanda crashes a party at Jim’s and discovers he is almost too good to be true. Voyeurism wreaks havoc between the two soulmates when Amanda sees what she believes to be Jim committing a murder. When the police fail to locate a body she takes it upon herself to get to the bottom of the matter, ably assisted and hindered by her model friends. Cast also includes Ivana Milicevic, Shalom Harlow, Tomiko Fraser and China Chow.

results.title: Head On
results.creator_credit: Head On Productions, Jane Scott and Ana Kokkinos
results.brief_description: Ana Kokkinos’s debut follows the angry, confused and nihilistic 19-year-old Greek Australian, Ari (Alex Dimitriades) through 24 hours fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family.

constellations_other.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_other.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Head On Productions, Jane Scott and Ana Kokkinos
results.description:
Based on the novel Loaded by Christos Tsiolkas, Ana Kokkinos’s compelling debut feature Head On is a volatile, confronting and at times bleak look at race, sexuality and class in contemporary Australian society. The film’s lead protagonist Ari (Alex Dimitriades) is an angry, confused, nihilistic, unemployed 19-year-old Greek Australian. The film traces a particularly explosive 24 hours in his life, fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family, who he views with equal amounts of respect and contempt. Performances are excellent throughout, in particular Paul Capsis as Ari’s defiant crossdressing friend Johnny/Toula.

Cast includes Elena Mandalis, Eugenia Fragos, Julian Garner, Dora Kaskanis, Alex Papps, Damien Fotiou. Awards: Best Actor (Alex Dimitriades) and Best Supporting Actor (Paul Capsis) for the 1999 Film Critics Circle of Australia Awards.

Best Feature Film Adaptation (Andrew Bovell, Ana Kokkinos, Mira Robertson) 1998 Awgie Awards.

Best Director (Ana Kokkinos) 1999 San Francisco Lesbian and Gay Film Festival.

Best Achievement in Editing (Jill Bilcock) 1998 AFI Awards.
description_for_label:
Based on the novel Loaded by Christos Tsiolkas, Ana Kokkinos’s compelling debut feature Head On is a volatile, confronting and at times bleak look at race, sexuality and class in contemporary Australian society. The film’s lead protagonist Ari (Alex Dimitriades) is an angry, confused, nihilistic, unemployed 19-year-old Greek Australian. The film traces a particularly explosive 24 hours in his life, fuelled by drugs, booze and anonymous sex as he grapples with his sexuality and clashes with his traditional Greek family, who he views with equal amounts of respect and contempt. Performances are excellent throughout, in particular Paul Capsis as Ari’s defiant crossdressing friend Johnny/Toula.

Cast includes Elena Mandalis, Eugenia Fragos, Julian Garner, Dora Kaskanis, Alex Papps, Damien Fotiou. Awards: Best Actor (Alex Dimitriades) and Best Supporting Actor (Paul Capsis) for the 1999 Film Critics Circle of Australia Awards.

Best Feature Film Adaptation (Andrew Bovell, Ana Kokkinos, Mira Robertson) 1998 Awgie Awards.

Best Director (Ana Kokkinos) 1999 San Francisco Lesbian and Gay Film Festival.

Best Achievement in Editing (Jill Bilcock) 1998 AFI Awards.
